p: Medicinal plants play significant role as raw material for important drugs; those are providing remedies against many human disorders. Report of world health organization (WHO) interpret that almost 80% of the worldâ€™s population rely on traditional system of folk remedies for primary health care and that is providing considerable economic benefit for the treatment of various diseases ( Igoli et al., 2005, Munazir et al., 2012). Medicinal plants produce diversity of secondary metabolites like polyphenols (flavonoids, tannins), saponins, alkaloids and carotenoids which are acts as potent antioxidant compounds ( Kaur et al., 2006). Even though flavonoids possess different biochemical activities however the preeminent defined property of flavonoids is the capability to act as antioxidant compounds ( Cody et al., 1986).
